subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... FWIW: I don t think you ve gone mad.  I don t think Pluggable Selector is a bad pattern.  My point is simply that reflection-based Pluggable Selector can
messageBody:
On 02/07/2006 09:01 PM, J. B. Rainsberger apparently said:
> Is that too much? I don't know. I know that Pluggable Selector gone mad
> is annoying like any other pattern gone mad. I just didn't think I'd
> gone mad, so I'm trying to understand why people think I did. :)
>
> Thanks for your feedback.

FWIW: I don't think you've gone mad. I don't think Pluggable Selector
is a bad pattern. My point is simply that reflection-based Pluggable
Selector can be costly, so the wise will use it wisely -- I am confident
that you are wise.

:)

--
Jason Rogers

Where there is no vision, the people perish...
Proverbs 29:18
